title: Firefox opens partial screen
content: Recently, FF opens on a partial screen. In order to go full screen I have to click on the resize button twice. Okay, not a biggie, just annoying. I've looked at some suggestions attached to other similar requests, but nothing fixes this. I know of nothing that I did that bring this on. I feel it started with the recent upgrade. I wonder if other users have had a similar experience. Thank you for any suggestions. Ken
creator: kenjaz

title: PC NOT WORKING WHEN I ATTEMPT TO OPEN ANY FUNCTIONS
content:
TURNED PC OFF LAST NIGHT - TRIED TO USE NOW - NOTHING CONNECTS - CLOSEST I GET IS MY 14 ACCOUNTS TITLES APPEAR - TRY TO OPEN AOL OR FB - DOESN'T WORK!!!!

I AM 81 YEARS OLD AND TECHNOLOGY CHALLENGED!!! DESPERATE FOR HELP!!!

SOME MALWARE HAS BEEN TRYING TO ADD ITSELF, AN ANTIVIRUS IS TRYING TO ADD ITSELF AND I THINK FF WANTS TO BE ADDED TO MY CELL PHONE = I DON'T HAVE A CELL PHONE!!!

GOT TO GET THIS MESS FIXED!!!! PLEASE HELP!!!!

title: Bookmarks etc
content: I didnt have an account and then someone was using my computer for months and logged into their account and then logged out and now all my bookmarks passwords etc are gone. Is there any way to recover my firefox even tho I didnt have an account? Im so upset. Thank you.

title: book mark menu
content: I have imported book marks back and forth to different browsers. Now that I have decided that FF is what I want, I'm trying to get it working properly. The big hangup is the bookmarks, I had trouble importing bookmarks and it looks like I have a bunch of menus. I have one bookmark that is set but it does not come up in the menu. In manage bookmarks, I find that I have several menus linked one to another. Is there some way to incorporate the menus into one?
